column4: I've set up sshd, and my DSL modem to forward everything to my router, then set up port forwarding and DHCP reservation
but I still can't connect, I just get Connection refused
waht do you try to accomplish !?
trying to connect via ssh remotely
pretty vague. Describe your situation more clearly. Linux box behind a DSL router, now you want to connnect from outside to inside ?
linux box behind a Linksys router, that's behind a Proline DSL modem
canyouseeme.org gives success, but no luck actually connecting with ssh
first, while you are logged in to your linux box, ssh to 127.0.0.1 or ssh nameofyourbox and see what hapens
that works
now your linksys, is it portforwarding port 22 to the internal ip of your linux box ?
yes, as of the value ifconfig gives me (192.168.2.101) and I even set it to reserve the IP
now your DSL modem ,i sthat portforwarding to the internal ip of your linksys !?
Static NAT enabled for 192.168.1.97
which is the address of the router
static nat ? that means that your outgoing (from INSIDE DSL to outside world) is natted !?
Hmm, should I just set DMZ on the DSL modem?
it says all unsolicited inbound traffic will be sent to that device (for the Static NAT)
hmmm if the DSL miodem says that, it should work i think
and killing it also makes canyouseeme say the port is unavailable
well you might setup tcpdump or ethereal on the linux box and see if anything is really reacjhing the linuxc box
if not maybe your linksys is not okay... thats all i can say about it.. sorry...
yeah how would you check that huh
just remove the linksys and see if it reaches the linux box ;-)
